paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2 gene, specifically the E637K variant, and its implications in Long QT syndrome type 2 (LQT2).

individual_records.evidence_sentence: WT/E637K-hERG cells demonstrated a significant reduction in maximal current amplitude compared to WT-hERG cells.

functional_data.summary: The E637K variant leads to a significant reduction in current amplitude and does not rescue channel function with PD-118057 or thapsigargin treatment.

variants.additional_notes: The E637K variant is described as a dominant-negative mutation.
key_quotes: The E637K-hERG mutant, which substitutes lysine for glutamic acid at position 637 in the pore-S6 loop transmembrane segment of hERG, has been identified as a dominant-negative mutation.
Our findings illustrate that neither PD-118057 nor thapsigargin play a role in correcting the dominant-negative effect of the E637K-hERG mutant.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the KCNH2 gene and its variants.
